venue.name: KeyBank Center
venue.address: 1 Seymour H Knox III Plaza, Buffalo, NY 14203

Rinkside.Description: Seats right next to the action for an unparalleled game experience.
Rinkside.View_Quality: Direct rink-level view, engaging and immersive experience.
Rinkside.Unique_Features: Chance for player interactions, possibility of being seen on TV.
Rinkside.Accessibility: Easy access, but limited space for personal mobility devices.
Rinkside.Special_Perks: Exclusive access to premium club areas, complimentary dining, and beverages.

Club_Seats.Description: Offering a fantastic view of the game from the sides with added benefits.
Club_Seats.View_Quality: Elevated side views with clear line of sight to the ice.
Club_Seats.Unique_Features: Wider seats with more leg room, less crowded sections.
Club_Seats.Accessibility: Dedicated entrance for easier access, nearby elevators.
Club_Seats.Special_Perks: Access to exclusive club lounges and in-seat wait service.

200_Level.Description: Great overall view of the game from an elevated position.
200_Level.View_Quality: Panoramic view of the rink, ideal for enjoying the game's flow.
200_Level.Unique_Features: Affordable pricing for a comprehensive view of the action.
200_Level.Accessibility: Accessible seating available, with easy access to amenities.
200_Level.Special_Perks: Cost-effective option with a satisfying view of the game.

100_Level.Description: Close to the action, offering vivid views without being at rink level.
100_Level.View_Quality: Near rink with a slightly elevated perspective for better viewing.
100_Level.Unique_Features: Good balance between proximity to the ice and ticket price.
100_Level.Accessibility: Wheelchair-accessible seating and convenient access to concessions.
100_Level.Special_Perks: Great mix of price, comfort, and view.

restaurants_bars.name: 716 Food and Sport
restaurants_bars.description: A massive, sports-themed eatery known for its giant TV screen and a wide selection of beers, perfect for Sabres fans to catch the game or grab a bite.

restaurants_bars.name: Liberty Hound
restaurants_bars.description: Situated close to the KeyBank Center, offering waterfront dining with a selection of seafood and American cuisine, great for a pre-game meal.

restaurants_bars.name: Pearl Street Grill & Brewery
restaurants_bars.description: A multi-level brewery and restaurant known for its house-made beers and hearty pub fare, boasting a lively atmosphere on game days.

restaurants_bars.name: Ballyhoo
restaurants_bars.description: A cozy spot famous for its sausages, craft cocktails, and a great selection of local beers, ideal for a casual pre-game gathering.

restaurants_bars.name: The Swannie House
restaurants_bars.description: One of Buffalo's oldest bars, offering a divey, no-frills atmosphere with classic pub grub, a stone's throw away from the arena.

restaurants_bars.name: Washington Square
restaurants_bars.description: Renowned for its relaxed vibe and an extensive beer list, this bar and grill serves up delicious American classics, making it a favorite among locals and visitors alike.

restaurants_bars.name: Soho Buffalo, NY
restaurants_bars.description: A popular bar and restaurant in the heart of Buffalo's entertainment district, offering a vibrant scene for post-game drinks and live music.

accommodations.name: Curtiss Hotel
accommodations.description: A luxury boutique hotel offering unique architectural beauty and modern comforts, situated in downtown Buffalo close to the KeyBank Center.

accommodations.name: Hotel at the Lafayette
accommodations.description: A historic hotel designed by America's first female professional architect, offering stylish accommodations near Buffalo's entertainment district and the KeyBank Center.

accommodations.name: Aloft Buffalo Downtown
accommodations.description: A contemporary hotel with vibrant decor and modern amenities, located in the heart of Buffalo, offering easy access to sporting events and city attractions.

accommodations.name: Buffalo Marriott at LECOM HARBORCENTER
accommodations.description: Situated in the HARBORCENTER complex, this hotel offers stunning views of the city and lake, with direct access to the KeyBank Center for Sabres games.

tourist_attractions.name: Canalside
tourist_attractions.description: A revitalized historic waterfront district offering a wide range of outdoor activities, concerts, and festivals, with stunning views of Lake Erie.

tourist_attractions.name: Buffalo Museum of Science
tourist_attractions.description: Features interactive exhibits on a variety of scientific topics, including biology, astronomy, and more, suitable for all ages.

tourist_attractions.name: Delaware Park
tourist_attractions.description: Designed by Frederick Law Olmsted, this expansive park offers scenic beauty, a lake, walking paths, and sports facilities, serving as Buffalo's version of Central Park.

tourist_attractions.name: Buffalo and Erie County Naval & Military Park
tourist_attractions.description: Americaâ€™s largest inland naval park, featuring several decommissioned US Naval vessels, including a submarine, destroyer, and cruiser.

tourist_attractions.name: Albright-Knox Art Gallery
tourist_attractions.description: A major hub for modern and contemporary art, housing an impressive collection of artworks from the 19th century to the present day.

team_related_activities.name: Sabres Store at KeyBank Center
team_related_activities.address: 1 Seymour H Knox III Plaza, Buffalo, NY 14203
team_related_activities.description: Official store for Buffalo Sabres merchandise, located within the KeyBank Center. A one-stop shop for all your Sabres apparel and memorabilia needs.

team_related_activities.name: Buffalo Sports Hall of Fame
team_related_activities.address: KeyBank Center, Buffalo, NY 14203 (Inside the arena)
team_related_activities.description: While not exclusively for the Sabres, the Buffalo Sports Hall of Fame showcases the city's rich sports history, including the Sabres' achievements, player artifacts, and memorabilia.

team_related_activities.name: Sabres Game Day Tours
team_related_activities.address: 1 Seymour H Knox III Plaza, Buffalo, NY 14203
team_related_activities.description: Explore KeyBank Center on game days with exclusive behind-the-scenes tours, offering fans a closer look at the home of the Sabres, including areas usually not open to the public.

options.description: The NFTA Metro Rail runs directly to KeyBank Center with stops at Special Events (only open during events) and Seneca Street, making it easily accessible from throughout the city.
Numerous bus routes operated by NFTA stop near KeyBank Center, providing convenient access for those coming from various parts of Buffalo and the surrounding suburbs.

best_places_to_buy.name: Official Team Website
best_places_to_buy.description: The primary source for all ticket sales, offering guaranteed authenticity for Sabres games.

best_places_to_buy.name: Ticketmaster
best_places_to_buy.description: Authorized ticketing partner providing authentic tickets for Sabres games.

best_places_to_buy.name: StubHub
best_places_to_buy.description: A reliable secondary marketplace that offers verified resold tickets for Sabres games.

ticket_purchasing_tips.ways_to_save: Buying tickets during the mid-week can often be cheaper than weekend games. Group ticket discounts often apply for groups of 10 or more. Some games may have last-minute ticket sales closer to the game day.
ticket_purchasing_tips.avoiding_scalpers: Always buy tickets from verified sources to avoid scams. If buying on the secondary market, ensure the website offers buyer guarantee. Avoid buying printed tickets from individuals on site as these can be duplicates or forgeries.
